description.narrative: 5.5 MEST, Local Councils and communities have the capacity to plan, prepare and respond to emergencies by end December 2019.,which contributes to Education In Emergencies, Equitable Access To Quality Education, Learning Outcomes. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: 5.0 Improved learning outcomes and equitable and inclusive education for all boys and girls by 2018

sector.narrative: Education sector planning including coordinating role, SDG 4, etc.
Other activities for equitable access to quality education e.g. school feeding, school grants
Provision of (formal and non-formal) primary education (including in temporary learning spaces)
Provision or procurement of multiple-levels (or alternative pathways of education) learning materials
System strengthening - risk informed programming, including climate, resilience, disaster, conflict, and emergency preparedness

description.narrative: Social Protection, Land Housing and Community Amenities disaster prevention and preparedness
Social Protection, Land Housing and Community Amenities emergency relief

title.narrative: Sierra Leone United Nations Development Assistance Framework
UNICEF Contract Awards through the UN Global Marketplace
Sierra Leone 2018 Annual Report on Results for Children
Sierra Leone 2019 Annual Report on Results for Children
Sierra Leone 2020 Annual Report on Results for Children
UNICEF Tender Notices through the UN Global Marketplace

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: 5.5 MEST, Local Councils and communities have the capacity to plan, prepare and respond to emergencies by end December 2019.

description.narrative: The Government of Sierra Leone's (GoSL) National Emergency Preparedness and Response Strategy is strengthened and Ministry of Basic and Senior Secondary Education (MBSSE) has greater capacity to develop and coordinate Disaster Risk Reduction (DRR) strategies based on global best practices and in line with the Sustainable Development Goals 11, 12, and 15 and the 2030 Agenda for Sustainable Development. There were no emergencies requiring Education in Emergencies interventions in the year. (Please see notes.) | Status:Met | As-of Date:31/12/2019

title.narrative: Number of DEOs personnel trained on Education in Emergency Coordination and Information Management
Service Delivery - Schools in a box or replenishment kits funded by UNICEF
Service Delivery - School-aged children and adolescents in affected areas back in school (including early childhood education programmes) after interruption or newly enrolled since the emergency
